data.title: Choose the correct answer for each question

sections.explain: Distinguishing between 'brake' and 'break' in everyday usage.

words.word: Use the brake to stop the car.
Use the break to stop the car.

sections.explain: Distinguishing between 'break' and 'brake' in everyday usage.

words.word: Be careful not to break the glass.
Be careful not to brake the glass.

sections.explain: Distinguishing between 'knight' and 'night' in everyday usage.

words.word: The knight wore shining armor.
The night wore shining armor.

sections.explain: Distinguishing between 'night' and 'knight' in everyday usage.

words.word: It was a dark and cold night.
It was a dark and cold knight.

sections.explain: Distinguishing between 'mail' and 'male' in everyday usage.

words.word: I received a letter in the mail.
I received a letter in the male.

sections.explain: Distinguishing between 'male' and 'mail' in everyday usage.

words.word: Only male students were in the group.
Only mail students were in the group.

sections.explain: Distinguishing between 'pair' and 'pear' in everyday usage.

words.word: I bought a new pair of shoes.
I bought a new pear of shoes.

sections.explain: Distinguishing between 'pear' and 'pair' in everyday usage.

words.word: She ate a juicy pear.
She ate a juicy pair.

sections.explain: Distinguishing between 'right' and 'write' in everyday usage.

words.word: Turn right at the corner.
Turn write at the corner.

sections.explain: Distinguishing between 'write' and 'right' in everyday usage.

words.word: Please write your name here.
Please right your name here.
